result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:10 pm. No appearance by defendant. Also called 15CM50. State - asks for restiutiton to be paid first from case 15CM49, balance to costs, amend only count Forest County ordinance of disorderly conduct with a fine of $300 plus costs. Burns pleads NC to amended charge. Court finds guility, imposes fine of $300 plus costs. Burns requestes payment plan, court so orders $50 p/month commencing 6/1/15. 15CM49 - State requests case to be dismissed but read in. Burns agrees. Victim notification has been complete. Court - 15CM49 dismisses and read in after restitution is applied.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Jennifer Atkins.

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:38 AM. Also called 15CM50. Burns - needs to address bond as the wrong amount was put on the wrong case. Court - 15CM50 - $150.00 cash that is already posted and on 15CM49 - modify bond to $200 signature bond, no contact with Jennifer Atkins and no consumption of alcohol and sign new bond on 15CM50 of $150.00 cash.

Defendant Obed P. Samuelson in court with attorney Mary Burns. Called 2:53 p.m. also called 15cm50 Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns has went over charges on criminial complaints, NG pleas. Sets cash bond of $150. No consumption of alcohol  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
